conversation.message:
Thanks for reaching out, Student_B—glad to hear School_E is your top choice.

In candidates, we value (1) strong academic preparation and consistency, (2) clear fit with our programs and community, and (3) evidence of initiative/leadership and follow-through. This cycle may be competitive, so a clear statement of why School_E is your first choice and how you’ll contribute can help.

If School_E is truly your first choice, you’re welcome to submit an [APPLY] as soon as you’re ready. Also, can you confirm whether you plan to apply to School_E this round or next, and what you’re most excited to pursue here (academics/activities)?

Student_A likely goes for D/A/B before E; Student_D likely never applies to E; Student_C might apply after D/C. Therefore, keep Student_B warm via [TALK], encourage an application, but do not promise acceptance; signal competitiveness and ask for timeline while keeping option open for Student_E (and possibly A/C).

Dear Student_B,

Thank you for checking in, and I appreciate how clear and respectful you’ve been throughout.

At this stage, the main reason we have not made an offer is that we are still preserving our remaining seat for the possibility that one of our higher-priority students may become available and apply to School_C in a later round. I also want to be fair to you: I can’t promise an offer later, and I would encourage you to continue actively pursuing other schools in parallel rather than waiting on School_C.

If you’d like, you can tell me whether you currently have any other live options you’re likely to accept soon; that context can help us understand timing on your side, even though our priority policy remains the same.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for the thoughtful question—and I appreciate how clearly you’ve communicated your willingness to commit.

To give you a realistic planning point: with one seat remaining, we are continuing to hold it for the possibility that a higher-priority student for School_C (Student_D, Student_E, or Student_A) becomes available and submits an application.
